headline.main: WOMEN DOCTORS AID FORCES IN BRITAIN; Many Serve at Base Hospitals and Some Overseas

lead_paragraph: Women doctors, none of whom was in Britain's armed forces before the war, have joined them in considerable numbers in administrative jobs, in hospitals at home and in a few cases hospitals overseas, said a statement issued in New York yesterday by the British Information Service.
abstract: Women drs aid mil forces; hold comms
